definition: Wei State (407-225 BC), one of the Seven Hero States of the Warring States 戰國七雄|战国七雄/Wei State or Cao Wei 曹魏 (220-265), the most powerful of the Three Kingdoms

surname Wei/name of vassal state of Zhou dynasty from 661 BC in Shanxi, one of the Seven Hero Warring States/Wei state, founded by Cao Cao 曹操[Cao2 Cao1], one of the Three Kingdoms after the Han dynasty/the Wei dynasty 221-265/Wei prefecture and Wei county at different historical periods
tower over a palace gateway (old)
surname Guo
country/nation/state/national/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Shang Yang's most contemptible acts of fraud should be defeated Wei.
sentences.chinese: 商鞅最令人不齿的行为应当是诈败魏国。

sentences.english: John wei Gu Andi will, not directly to tell what happened.
sentences.chinese: 魏国强不顾安迪意愿，直接将当初发生的事情说出。

sentences.english: Andy saw John wei, know that he is her father Wei Wei mouth.
sentences.chinese: 安迪见到魏国强，知道他就是魏渭口中她的生父。

sentences.english: The Li family have their origins back hundreds of years to the kingdom of Wei during the warring states period.
sentences.chinese: 李氏家族的血统来自几百年以前，战国时期的魏国。

sentences.english: A minister, Pang Cong, was to accompany him.
sentences.chinese: 魏国大臣庞聪，将要陪魏太子到赵国去作人质。

sentences.english: During the Warring States Period (475-221BC), there was a man called Yue Yangzi in State Yue.
sentences.chinese: 战国时期，魏国有个叫乐羊子的人。

sentences.english: In the warring States Period, a man called Yue Yangzi lived in the State of Wei.
sentences.chinese: 战国时期，魏国有个叫乐羊子的人。

sentences.english: The king of the State of Wei appreciates his archery very much and often goes hunting with him.
sentences.chinese: 魏国国王很欣赏他的射箭技术经常和他一起去打猎。

sentences.english: The current cold weather, it is better first went to the south of Wei and Chu Shou Fu .
sentences.chinese: 目前天冷，不如先去收服南方的魏国和楚国。

sentences.english: When Panggong came back from Handan, the Emperor Wei never interviewed him.
sentences.chinese: 当庞恭从邯郸回魏国时，魏王再也不愿意召见他了。

sentences.english: During the Warring States Period , there was a man called Yue Yangzi in State Yue.
sentences.chinese: 战国时期，魏国有个叫乐羊子的人。

sentences.english: Qin saw the opportunity, first with Qi Lianheng, Wei introduction of large tracts of land.
sentences.chinese: 秦国看准时机，先与齐连横，攻略魏国大片土地。

definition: the state of Qin, one of the seven states of the Warring States Period (475-220 BC)
Zhao, one of the seven states during the Warring States Period of Chinese history (475-220 BC)
Qi state of Western Zhou and the Warring states (1122-265 BC), centered in Shandong
the state of Chu, one of the most important of the small states contending for power in China between 770 and 223 BC, located around present-day Hubei
Cao Wei, the most powerful of the Three Kingdoms, established as a dynasty in 220 by Cao Pi 曹丕, son of Cao Cao, replaced by Jin dynasty in 265

Yan, a vassal state of Zhou in modern Hebei and Liaoning/north Hebei/the four Yan kingdoms of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Yan 前燕 (337-370), Later Yan 後燕|后燕 (384-409), Southern Yan 南燕 (398-410), Northern Yan 北燕 (409-436)
Wu state (in south China, in different historical periods)/Wu state 220-280, founded by Sun Quan 孫權|孙权 the southernmost of the three Kingdoms
Sichuan/the state of Shu in Sichuan at different periods/the Shu Han dynasty (214-263) of Liu Bei 劉備|刘备 during the Three Kingdoms
Eastern Wu (222-280)/the southern state of Wu during the Three Kingdoms period, founded by Sun Quan 孫權|孙权
Shu Han (c. 200-263), Liu Bei's kingdom in Sichuan during the Three Kingdoms, claiming legitimacy as successor of Han
the Qin army (model for the terracotta warriors)
Lu, vassal state at the time of the Zhou Dynasty 周朝|周朝[Zhou1 chao2], located in the southwest of present-day Shandong 山東|山东[Shan1 dong1], birthplace of Confucius
Yuan Shao (153-202), general during late Han, subsequently warlord
Sun Quan (reigned 222-252), southern warlord and king of state of Wu 吳|吴 in the Three Kingdoms period
King Min of Qi (reigned 323-284 BC)
King Huiwen of Zhao 趙國|赵国, reigned 298-266 BC during the Warring States Period
